events.originalText: Mexican drug war: Forty-four inmates died in a prison riot in Apodaca, Mexico, between members of Los Zetas and the Gulf Cartel.
events.subtitle: Mexican drug war
events.headline: 44 Inmates Killed in Prison Riot in Apodaca, Mexico

events.originalText: Items from the Belitung shipwreck, the largest single collection of Tang-dynasty artefacts found in one location, were first exhibited in Singapore.
events.subtitle: Belitung shipwreck
events.headline: Belitung Shipwreck Artefacts Exhibited in Singapore

events.originalText: A methane explosion in a coal mine in Nueva Rosita, Mexico, trapped and killed 65 miners.
events.subtitle: Methane
events.headline: 65 Miners Trapped and Killed in Methane Explosion in Nueva Rosita, Mexico

events.originalText: The first module of the Soviet space station Mir was launched, establishing the first long-term research station in space.
events.subtitle: Mir Core Module
events.headline: First Module of Soviet Space Station Mir Launched

events.originalText: Colonel Phạm Ngọc Thảo of the Army of the Republic of Vietnam, along with Generals Lâm Văn Phát and Trần Thiện Khiêm attempted a coup against the military junta of Nguyễn Khánh.
events.subtitle: Phạm Ngọc Thảo
events.headline: Coup Attempt Against Military Junta in Vietnam

events.originalText: Betty Friedan's The Feminine Mystique, a non-fiction book credited with sparking the beginning of second-wave feminism in the United States, was first published.
events.subtitle: Betty Friedan
events.headline: Betty Friedan's The Feminine Mystique Published

events.originalText: The U.S. Central Intelligence Agency planted a cache of Soviet-made weapons on a beach in Nicaragua, as part of an effort to portray Guatemalan President Jacobo Árbenz as a Soviet puppet.
events.subtitle: Central Intelligence Agency
events.headline: CIA Plants Weapons in Nicaragua to Frame Guatemalan President

events.originalText: The Southeast Asian Youth Conference, which is believed to have inspired armed communist rebellions in different Asian countries, opened in Calcutta, India.
events.subtitle: Conference of Youth and Students of Southeast Asia Fighting for Freedom and Independence
events.headline: Southeast Asian Youth Conference Opens in Calcutta, India

events.originalText: A book-burning was held and politicians were arrested in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, as part of a simulated Nazi invasion.
events.subtitle: Winnipeg
events.headline: Book-Burning and Arrests in Winnipeg, Canada

events.originalText: Second World War: In the largest attack mounted by a foreign power against Australia, more than 240 Japanese aircraft bombed the city of Darwin (pictured).
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese Aircraft Bomb Darwin in Largest Attack on Australia

events.originalText: World War II: U.S. president Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066, authorizing the forcible relocation of over 112,000 Japanese Americans to internment camps.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Executive Order 9066 Signed for Japanese American Internment

events.originalText: Italian forces began a brutal crackdown on Ethiopians following an attempted assassination of Rodolfo Graziani, the viceroy of Italian East Africa, in Addis Ababa.
events.subtitle: Yekatit 12
events.headline: Italian Crackdown in Ethiopia after Assassination Attempt

events.originalText: Old Trafford, a football stadium in Greater Manchester, England, hosted its inaugural match, between Manchester United and Liverpool.
events.subtitle: Old Trafford
events.headline: Old Trafford Hosts Inaugural Match Between Manchester United and Liverpool

events.originalText: A blockade against Venezuela (depicted), caused by President Cipriano Castro's refusal to pay foreign debts, is lifted.
events.subtitle: Venezuelan crisis of 1902–1903
events.headline: Blockade Against Venezuela Lifted

events.originalText: Peninsular War: Outnumbered French forces under Édouard Mortier routed and nearly destroyed Spanish troops at the Battle of the Gebora near Badajoz, Spain.
events.subtitle: Peninsular War
events.headline: French Forces Rout Spanish Troops at Battle of the Gebora

events.originalText: Huaynaputina, a stratovolcano in present-day Peru, produced the largest recorded volcanic explosion in South America.
events.subtitle: Huaynaputina
events.headline: Huaynaputina Volcano Produces Largest Recorded Explosion in South America
